      • testChmod

        public void testChmod()
               throws Exception
        Test Chmod 1. Create and write file on FS 2. Verify that exit code for chmod on existing file is 0 3. Verify that exit code for chmod on non-existing file is 1 4. Verify that exit code for chmod with glob input on non-existing file is 1 5. Verify that exit code for chmod with glob input on existing file in 0
        Throws:
        Exception

      • testChown

        public void testChown()
               throws Exception
        Test Chown 1. Create and write file on FS 2. Verify that exit code for Chown on existing file is 0 3. Verify that exit code for Chown on non-existing file is 1 4. Verify that exit code for Chown with glob input on non-existing file is 1 5. Verify that exit code for Chown with glob input on existing file in 0
        Throws:
        Exception

      • testChgrp

        public void testChgrp()
               throws Exception
        Test Chgrp 1. Create and write file on FS 2. Verify that exit code for chgrp on existing file is 0 3. Verify that exit code for chgrp on non-existing file is 1 4. Verify that exit code for chgrp with glob input on non-existing file is 1 5. Verify that exit code for chgrp with glob input on existing file in 0

        Exception

      • assertIllegalArguments

        private static void assertIllegalArguments(FsCommand cmd,
                          String... args)
        Asserts that for the given command, the given arguments are considered invalid. The expectation is that the command will throw IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        cmd - FsCommand to check
        args - String... arguments to check

      • assertValidArgumentsOnWindows

                                 String... args)
        Asserts that for the given command, the given arguments are considered valid on Windows, but invalid elsewhere.
        Parameters:
        cmd - FsCommand to check
        args - String... arguments to check
